result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy Guzman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Refer Debt to the WI Dept of Revenue, along with supporting Reminder Notices.
Criminal Case Settlement
with attached victim restitution request form(s)
with elements

Cases 16CF91, 16CF180, 16CF190, 16CM137 called together at 11:20am [MA]
Defendant Roy  Guzman in court, in custody with attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance in all cases; submits victim impact statement for case 16CM137

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; 

pleas of " GUILTY " entered on Counts #1 and #4 of Case 16CF91
plea of " GUILTY " entered on Count# 2 of Case 16CF190
plea of " GUILTY " entered on Count# 2 of Case 16CM137

Factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2, 3, 5, and 6 of Case 16CF91, Case 16CF180, Count #1 of Case 16CF190, Count #1 of Case 16CM137

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #4 of Case 16CF91, the Court sentences the Defendant: 
--To serve 45 days  in the Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--To pay fine of $350+ costs; to be converted to civil judgement
--Revocation of drivers license for 14 months
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations 
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 14 month period  
--provide DNA sample

The Court does NOT order attendance at a victim impact panel


On Count #1 of Case 16CF91, the Court sentences the Defendant: 
--To serve  90 days   in the Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to the sentence in Count #4 of Case 16CF91
--costs to be converted to civil judgment

On Count #2 of Case 16CM137, the Court sentences the Defendant: 
--To serve   60 days   in the Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT  Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being.
--$100 in restitution to Breanna Hutter, to be converted to civil judgment
--costs to be converted to civil judgment

On Count #2 of Case 16CF190, the Court sentences the Defendant: 
--To serve  20 days  in the Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being 
--costs to be converted to civil judgment

Days Credit: 133, to be applied to Case 16CF91, Count #4 first and then Count #1, then cases 16CM137 and 16CF190 until credit is exhausted
recess: 12:05pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Cases 16CF91, 16CF190,16CF180,16CM137 called together at 11:47am [MA]
Defendant Roy  Guzman in court, in custody with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies a victim rights compliance

Atty. Luchsinger informs the Court that Defense is prepared to proceed to resoluton today.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 

recess: 11:52am

NEXT: Plea and Sentencing on 9/20/16 at 11:00am (allow 1/2 hour)
Status conference on September 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.

[MK[ cases #16CF180, #16CF190, #16CF91, #16CM137 called at 8:33am. 
Defendant Roy Guzman in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 
Waiver of Preliminary Hearing & Arraignments occurs in Cases #16CF180 & #16CF190:
--Mr. Guzman waives his right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trials.
--Service of Informations admitted, reading waived
--Pleas of "not guilty" entered

Attorney Luchsinger requests that all cases be scheduled for Status Conference in approximately three weeks.
recess 8:41am
Status conference on August 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

[MK] cases #16CF91, #16CF180, #16CM137, #16CF190 called at 2:05pm. 
Defendant Roy  Guzman in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 
ADA Hall notes that Case #16CF190 was not on the Court's calendar today, however this case is at Prelim stage, as is Case #16CF180.
Attorney Luchsinger indicates that the parties are close to a resolution in these cases.  Mr. Guzman is currently on an immigration-related hold, so this factor is part of the discussions regarding these cases.
The Court and counsel address scheduling. 
recess 2:09pm. 

NEXT:  (1) remove the Case #16CF190 Status Conference set for 8/9/16 from the Court's calendar,  (2) schedule cases #16CF180 and #16CF190 for Preliminary Hearing, and schedule cases #16CM137 and #16CF91 for Status Conference--- all on 8/15/16 at 8:30am
for continuance
Status conference on August 2, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
for continuance

Cases 16CF91 and 16CM137 called together at 8:14am [mo]
Defendant Roy  Guzman in court, in custody.

The Court reviews Court Record as to Court's Order re: repayment of attorney fees.
The Court note that as of 5/24/16  there has been a cash bond and Mr. Guzman has been unable to post that cash bond, therefore not allowing Mr. Guzman to have any income; Mr. Guzman confirms this information
The Court suspends the prior order to make payments to the county for his attorney.
The Court instructs Mr. Guzman to reapply to the SPD; gives him direction as to how to contact the SPD office from the jail.
recess: 8:19am
Payment hearing on July 22, 2016 at 08:10 am.
from Bookkeeping RE: Failure to Comply with Court Order with notation from Court and JA
Status conference on August 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 22, 2016 at 03:20 pm.
to Cover Cases 16CF91, 16CM137, and 16CF180

Cases 16CF91, 16CM137, 16CT135, 16CF180 called together at 10:47am [mo]
Defendant Roy  Guzman in court, in custody with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Luchsinger requests all cases be scheduled for ptc

As to Case 16CM137(Initial Appearance occurs):
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

As to Case 16CF180(Initial Appearance occurs): 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
No Demand for Speedy Trial
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 

Appointment forthcoming from the SPD for Atty. Luchsinger.

As to Case 16CF91:
Atty. Luchsinger admits service of the Amended Criminal Complaint; waives reading 
The Court notes that the prior stipulation of the parties that the preliminary hearing as to Count #1 continue

As to Case 16CT135 and 16CT202:
The State moves to dismiss the charges because the offense has been addressed and subsumed within 16CF91
--no objection from Atty. Luchsinger
The Court grants the State's motion 

As to the State's Motion for Bond Modification:
--no objection from Atty. Luchsinger. 

The Court requires a $1500 CASH Bond to cover cases 16CF91, 16M137, and 16CF180, with non monetary conditions as previously ordered in case 16CF91, additionally the Court orders Booking in case 16CF180.

recess: 11:07am 
NEXT: (1)Pretrial Conference on 6/22/16 at 3:20pm (2)Status Conference on 8/9/16 at 10:00am

Court appoints Attorney Luchsinger for cases 16CF91 & 16CM137

Court orders reimbursement of $200 per month with the first payment due on 4/18/16
